Before going any further, let me write a quick announcment:

Recently, several side projects are demanding my time and it makes it difficult for me to contribute to this blog as I used to be. Here are a few things that I’m doing on the side:

  • I’ve started a videocast series on Node.JS Performance.
  • I’ve started a side project about semantically organizing content (which has been my passion for the last ten-or-so years ).
  • I have other ubiqutous writing projects (like books and transcripts.).

…

Videocasting is a convoluted process:

Not only you’ll have to script your talk, but you’ll need to rehearse it, record it (a dry run, followed by two or three actual recordings), edit it, and publish it. They all take a tremendous amount of time (I can confidently say that each five minute content requires an hour of hard work end-to-end).

When combine all the publishing work, and add the focus I need for my side project on top of it, it’s not unrealistic to assume that there won’t be much activity on this blog :).

At least, that will be the case for a while.
